key_points: The New Mexico Occupational Health and Safety Bureau is investigating the accidental shooting on the set of 'Rust'.
Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed and director Joel Souza was wounded in the incident.
The bureau can impose civil penalties for workplace accidents regardless of criminal findings.
Rebecca Roose, deputy cabinet secretary of the New Mexico Environment Department, confirmed the investigation to Deadline.
The incident is also under investigation by the Santa Fe Sheriff’s Office and the state’s top prosecutor.
Alec Baldwin discharged the weapon that killed Hutchins and injured Souza.
The fatal incident occurred at Bonanza Creek Ranch just outside Santa Fe.
First Judicial District Attorney Mary Carmack-Altwies stated the case is still in the preliminary stages of investigation.
Rust Movie Productions, LLC is conducting an internal review and will cooperate with authorities.
The production company is also offering mental health services to the cast and crew.
spokespersons: Rebecca Roose (Deputy Cabinet Secretary, New Mexico Environment Department)
